ch.ethz.inspire.emod.utils

Class Algo

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.ethz.inspire.emod.utils.Algo

  • public class Algo
extends java.lang.Object
    Class implementing mathematical utility functions for algorithms. Most of this functions are defined static.
    Author:
    andreas

    • Method Detail

      • doubleLinearInterpolation

        public static double doubleLinearInterpolation(double x,
                               double z,
                               double[] xsamples,
                               double[] ysamples,
                               double[][] zvalues)
        Double linear interpolation. Given two vectors xsamples={xi|i=1,2...n} and ysamples={yj|j=1,2...m}, as well as a matrix zvalues={zij|i=1,2,...n , j=1,2,...m}, the value y is estimated based on x and z by double linear interpolation: - zvec = {zvecj|j=1,2,...,m} is estimated by a linear interpolation for each column of z at the value x - y is estimated by a linear interpolation on zvec at z
        Parameters:
        y - y-value
        z - z-value
        xsamples - Samples 'x_i' of the 'zvalues'.
        ysamples - Samples 'y_j' of the 'zvalues'.
        zvalues - Set of sample values ( z_ij=f(x_i, y_j) )
        Returns:
        x, estimated by double linear interpolation

      • logInterpolation

        public static double logInterpolation(double x,
                      double[] xsamples,
                      double[] yvals)
        Logarithmic interpolation A function is given by a set of (x,y) points. The y-value belonging to a given x value is determined by logarithmic interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x - Value on the x axis to find the corresponding y value.
        xsamples - Samples on the x axis. Must be sorted (lowest value at first position).
        yvals - Samples on the y axis.
        Returns:
        y-value belonging to 'x'.

      • bilinearInterpolation

        public static double bilinearInterpolation(double x,
                           double y,
                           double[] xsamples,
                           double[] ysamples,
                           double[][] zvalues)
        Bilinear interpolation. A two-dimensional function z=f(x,y) is given by a set of sample values ( z_ij=f(x_i, y_j) ). The z-value of the point (x,y) is calculated by bilinear interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x - x-value
        y - y-value
        xsamples - Samples 'x_i' of the 'zvalues'.
        ysamples - Samples 'y_j' of the 'zvalues'.
        zvalues - Set of sample values ( z_ij=f(x_i, y_j) )
        Returns:
        The bilinear interpolation at the point (x,y) for the function specified by 'xsamples', 'ysamples' and 'zvalues'.

      • linearInterpolation

        public static double linearInterpolation(double x,
                         double[] xsamples,
                         double[] yvals)
        A function is given by a set of (x,y) points. The y-value belonging to a given x value is determined by linear interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x - Value on the x axis to find the corresponding y value.
        xsamples - Samples on the x axis. Must be sorted (lowest value at first position).
        yvals - Samples on the y axis.
        Returns:
        y-value belonging to 'x'.

      • linearInterpolationWithIndex

        private static double linearInterpolationWithIndex(double x,
                                  double[] xsamples,
                                  double[] yvals,
                                  int index)
        A function is given by a set of (x,y) points. The y-value belonging to a given x value is determined by linear interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x - Value on the x axis to find the corresponding y value.
        xsamples - Samples on the x axis. Must be sorted (lowest value at first position).
        yvals - Samples on the y axis.
        index - From 'x' and 'xsamples', the index is calculated such that xsamples[index] <= x < xsamples[index+1]
        Returns:
        y-value belonging to 'x'.

      • logInterpolationWithIndex

        private static double logInterpolationWithIndex(double x,
                               double[] xsamples,
                               double[] yvals,
                               int index)
        A function is given by a set of (x,y) points. The y-value belonging to a given x value is determined by logarithmic interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x - Value on the x axis to find the corresponding y value.
        xsamples - Samples on the x axis. Must be sorted (lowest value at first position).
        yvals - Samples on the y axis.
        index - From 'x' and 'xsamples', the index is calculated such that xsamples[index] <= x < xsamples[index+1]
        Returns:
        y-value belonging to 'x'.

      • findInterval

        public static int findInterval(double x,
               double[] vals)
        Within a increasing sequence of values, find the interval where a given value lies in. The sequence if given as an sorted array. The function returns the lower index of the interval where the value 'x' lies in. The following condition is true: vals[index] <= x < vals[index+1] where index is the return value.
        Parameters:
        x - Value
        vals - Sorted array (The first entry is the smallest)
        Returns:
        Return the index of the last value in the array 'vals' that is smaller or equal as the value x. If the value 'x' is smaller than the first entry, return -1.
